comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Charles Otway Alexander Son of Capt. James Fane Alexander (1846-1891), 17th Lancers, Edwinstowe, Notts. Married (1915, St Marylebone, Greater London) Antonia Marie Geermans, daughter of Adrianus Geermans, of The Hague, Holland; one son, two daughters. 01.01.1888 - 13.04.1970 Woodbridge, Suffolk A/S.Lt. ? S.Lt. 15.03.1907 Lt. 15.06.1908 Lt.Cdr. 15.06.1916 Cdr. 31.12.1919 Capt. 31.12.1927 (retd 10.01.1939) Cdre. 2nd cl. 31.10.1939? R.Adm. (retd) 10.01.1939 (reverted to retd 1945 [< 07.1945]) Education: HMS Britannia 15.09.1902 joined RN 1904 - 1907 HMS Bulwark & HMS Venerable (Mediterranean & Lagos) 1914 - 1918 served Great War: 15.10.1918 - (01.1919) Torpedo Officer, HMS Renown (battleship) 15.08.1924 - (01.1925) Fleet Torpedo Officer, Atlantic Fleet [HMS Revenge (battleship)] 15.09.1925 - (07.1927) Torpedo Division, Admiralty [HMS President] 08.03.1929 - (02.1931) Deputy Director of Torpedoes and Mining Department, Admiralty [HMS President] 12.10.1931 - (01.1932) Senior Officers' War Course, RN War College, Greenwich 27.07.1932 - (02.)1935 Commanding Officer, HMS Dauntless (cruiser) (America and West Indies Station & Mediterranean) (07.1935) no appointment listed 23.08.1935 - (07.1937) Commanding Officer, HMS Ganges (boys' training establishment, Shotley) & Captain-in-Charge, Harwich 27.08.1937 - (10.1938) Commanding Officer, HMS Cornwall (cruiser) 10.08.1938 - (10.1938) Naval ADC to the King 31.10.1939 - (12.1943) Commanding Officer, HMS Raleigh (training establishment, Trevol, Torpoint, Cornwall) 03.1944 - (06.1944) HMS Drake (RN base, Devonport) Published various articles in sporting press. www.unithistories.com/officers/RN_officersA3.html

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Gazetted December 27, 1907 Charles Otway Alexander Acting Sub-Lieutenant . . . confirmed in the rank of Sub-Lieutenant in His Majesty's Fleet 15 March 1907 Son of Captain James Fane Alexander (1846 -1891) Children born to Captain James Fane Alexander and Aurea Otway Mayne Major Paul Robert Mayne Alexander b. 16 Sep 1885, d. 7 Jan 1954 Rear-Admiral Charles Otway Alexander b. 1 Jan 1888, d. 13 Apr 1970 Captain William James Alexander b. 6 Jul 1891, d. 27 Apr 1947 www.thepeerage.com/p25935.htm#i259349 Children born to Rear-Admiral Charles Otway Alexander and Antonia Marie Geermans Pamela Aurea Alexander b. 30 Dec 1915 Gian Mary Alexander b. 20 Feb 1919 Michael Charles Alexander b. 20 Nov 1920 www.thepeerage.com/p25937.htm#i259363

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Son Michael C Alexander Two obituaries here alt.obituaries.narkive.com/ip1tWkG2/michael-alexander-wri...: from The Independent: Michael Charles Alexander, writer: born London 20 November 1920; editorial director, Common Ground 1946-50; editorial director, Oxford University Press 1950-51; married 1963 Sarah Wignall (one adopted daughter; marriage dissolved); died London 19 December 2004. . . . from The Telegraph: Michael Alexander, who has died aged 84, was one of a group of well-connected British prisoners-of-war held at the infamous Colditz Castle from 1942 to 1945; he went on to enjoy post-war success as a writer, adventurer, incurable romantic and restaurateur. . . .
